rComments: With all due respect Prof. Tawfiq can't teach. He over complicates everything and makes it incredibly difficult to absorb anything during class. As a result, attending lectures isn't mandatory. In fact, it will suffice to simply do the online assignments. Avoid this prof at all costs, whether the course title entices you; trust me, you'll regret it

Lectures are disorganized, hard to follow, and not very helpful when preparing for evaluations. Which by the way, is unfair in terms of exam length and difficulty. Prof. Tawfiq doesnt appear to take into consideration any student input, I felt like I was truly on my own for this course. I loved physics until I took this course..
Worst prof Id so far, wants you to fail

Objectively, Prof Tawfiq is actually a really nice guy. His tests are too hard, but I think he knows that, so you can count on a bell curve. Honestly, I passed because my TA was awesome, and I was more comfortable going to someone that knew me than the prof. But I have no complaints about Tawfiq.
He is a very good professor . His lectures are clear and very well explained, also his notes are well organized and very helpful. Finally, he is very caring and extremely respectful towards students.
he doesn't teach well and expects results

Not a fun course. His lectures are just a blur in my mind. To prepare for his tests do the questions at the back for each chapter in the textbook. Some questions on the tests were taken directly from the textbook. Good luck with the multiple choice, though.  -_- I only passed the course because of the lab component and bell curve.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters', 'Tough grader']

rComments: He means well I think, but his execution is just not there. Disorganized and boring lectures, you can barely understand what he's saying and he's sprinting around where by the end of the class he's worked up a sweat. It's an uncomfortable atmosphere. His tests are unfair and his answers to content questions are useless. Do not take this.

Avg for 1st midterm was 46. He only bell curved it to 58. He made 30% of the mc answers for the second midterm 'None of the above'. Wants to fail out students. Grades us like it's a competition, not on our understanding. Horrible teaching style. Im one of the top marks and I'm still transferring to utsg because of the poor quality education here.

He has the right intentions and wants you to pass, but as most teachers in high school warn you, profs are not teachers. They're not trained. He expects you to know everything about physics before you show up, even though most of what is taught in lecture was not taught in high school. If Tawfiq is supposed to teach your course, wait til next yeear

I don't have a problem with his grading or lectures, I find the material easy. But he's the worst person to ask for help! He gets frustrated when you don't understand yet refuses to listen or find where you went wrong. Strict for the wrong reasons - learning needs to be an open and encouraging process, not make you feel ashamed and afraid to speak

Tawfiq often means well, but is someone who has a distorted and poor understanding of how to effectively conduct and manage a class. The fundamental issue with ST is that he refuses to listen. Listening means to Reflect on student feedback; to Examine how marks reflect student understanding; to Communicate with TAs abt marking expectations.
Very disorganized, unclear explanations, doesn't listen when people talk to him, stubborn, assignment and tests are all over the place
Certainly frustrating....

Nice guy but tough marker. Exams are extremely difficult and the questions are nothing close to the ones in the textbook. Useless lecture notes, unclear, not enough practice questions in class. Beware.

Trust me mate just one sentence sums up my whole experience for this class :You shall not pass. Guy's a major bellend. Come on seriously mate physics is so interesting that me, a student with culinary arts major, fell in love with it. Then comes this bloke and wrecks everything with his lovely tests. Someone needs to teach this lad how to chill 101

Professor Tawfiq's  entire course organization was not at the level you expect from UofT. Lectures are extremely boring and disorganized. He makes jokes in the class which nobody gets. The exams are messed up, you have to hand in the multiple choice in the middle of the exam and then do problems! I got an A but I wish I didnt have taken it with him
Cool guy ! :) Hard class though ! Go to class, and do lots of problems !
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'EXTRA CREDIT']

rComments: Great professor

He goes really fast in his lectures and DOESN'T really know HOW TO TEACH a lesson. Small class size, but he usually leaves his students very confused. He's not helpful at all in any aspects. I am now a physics/Math teacher, he always reminds me of what qualities a good physics/math teacher should possess.

PHYA10, PHYA21, PHYB20, and PHYB24. All were very HARD. His lectures are incomprehensible, and although you can go to his office at any time, his help is nearly useless. He also goes through the material way too fast, and his class is designed so that only the VERY intelligent students do well, and the average students fail/do very poorly.

this class started with like 20 somthing ppl then dropped down to 10, then 9 before exam. He might be good at teaching the phya series, but definitely not the higher levels physics. Useless lecture. lecs are too conceptual, needed more practical problem solvings. No text book to follow. Very tough marker and difficult tests and assignments.

Going to his lec is not helpful at all. He CAN NOT teach! NO text book, with useless online lec notes. Need to do research for almost every assignment. He surprises you in every test, putting out questions that you've never seen before, and are totally unexpected and difficult. He goes extremely fast and is HARD MARKER!!! BE CAREFUL!!!!!

great prof. extremely helpful. just that he likes too teach so much extra materials to make us study a lot more than required. his exams are actually simple but focused and in depth...so good luck on guessing the topics it works sometimes

Tawfiq is a very good professor, very accessable. The problem is the university should have different physics courses for physical science student and life science student. A10 and 21 is easy for physical science student but difficult for life science student. I feel Tawfiq does a very good job to accomodate all students.
well, i don't find the exams that hard, but the first year physics labs are more miserable than HELL... i know this person who is getting A in exams and failing the labs...

Now you won't find a prof like him, he is a really hardworking prof who actually wants to help students but the problem with physics is  you have to have the fundamental basics to follow his courses. I mean you can't blame him for that. I went to his final with 37% on midterm and quizzes and 70% on the lab report which was 20% and ended up with 62

awesome prof, very very nice to students.. welcomes questions .. and understands struggling.. he is soo open to students ideas and problems .. very good communication skills in that sense.. otherwise the man has an accent.. big deal .. half of Canada does. point is .. he gets physics through to students much better than other profs.

I think some of the comments here unfair. Prof. Tawfiq was one of the best profs. He never hide from students' questions(many other profs do), he has that kind of spirit that u can never find a question which screw him up. Obviously, English is not his mother tongue, so it's rude to comment him like people before. He's fair if you talk to him ab
drop the course since when he teaches he always goes like this aaa lalala bababa tatata sasasa...  like someone already mentioned below.

The lectures aren't helpful at all unless you've done prior reading and understanding to ask questions. His exams are hard but you can tell he tries. He always teaches with a smile on his face and is VERY welcoming for people who show interest. Easily approachable and if you don't understand, he will explain things happily! overall great proff

he is an extremely helpful prof....but he goes at a very rapid pace and his exam are way too hard...even after doing the assignments, reading text,attending lectures and tutorials and going through the lecture slides, i felt i was still nil in physics....glad i am done with physics !!
Well he does not have a good communication skill, but he tries, i appreciate that!
aaa.. aaa.. "Good Afternoon ...aaa.. Everybody". " Welcome ...aa.. to the aaa.. most boring ... aa.. lecture in the history of UofT. .. " Thank You . Good Bye. . ;(
Once i heard this sentence in his lecture "THE DIRECTION OF ACCELERATION IS IN THIS DIRECTION"....which really interested me and I am still wondering which direction he was pointing to.

till highschool i was really intersted in physics...but after attendin his lectures...i lost my interest..am like "SCREW PHYSICS"..n yeah...if u didnt get enough sleep at home..u can have comfortable sleep in the lecture room especially when hez teachin...cuz 25% of the lecture hall is empty :p

His lectures are boring because he doesn't have good communication skill. His exams are totally different than what he teaches in the lectures. He introduced 3% of presence in tutorials just to make students attend them. He should realize by now HE IS NOT A GOOD PROF.
EXCELLENT TEACHING ABILITIES :D
proff salam really know what he's talking about... greate proff..he's super clear in his lectures and funny..ps> he is really cute
very helpful, but moves very fast, great professor
No Comments
he goes really fast
